00:00:02:010000.Speaker: Priya
00:00:02:010000.Dialogue: My brother-- he's got a big crush on Bernadette.

00:00:18:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:18:130000.Dialogue: It's-It's not what it looks like.

00:00:29:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:29:020000.Dialogue: It's not what it looks like.

00:00:33:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:33:150000.Dialogue: It's not what it looks like.

00:00:42:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:42:120000.Dialogue: She and Koothrappali emerge from your bedroom. She is disheveled, and Raj is dressed only in a sheet. The sole clue: "It's not what it looks like."

00:00:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:190000.Dialogue: If I could, I would, but I can't, so I shan't.

00:01:01:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:150000.Dialogue: Now, knowing Penny, the obvious answer is, they engaged in coitus. But... since that's what it looked like, we can rule that out.

00:01:13:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:13:120000.Dialogue: Let's put on our thinking cap, shall we?

00:01:21:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:21:190000.Dialogue: Raj is from India, a tropical country. Third World hygiene. Parasitic infections are common, such as pinworms. Mm-hmm. The procedure for diagnosing pinworms is to wait until the subject is asleep, and the worms crawl out of the rectum for air.

00:01:47:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:47:110000.Dialogue: Penny could have been inspecting Raj's anal region for parasites. Oh, boy. That's a true blue friend.

00:01:59:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:59:080000.Dialogue: No, you weren't listening. She said it's not what it looks like.

00:02:13:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:13:110000.Dialogue: Don't I look silly sitting here wearing this?

00:03:06:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:100000.Dialogue: Leonard, is it awkward for you knowing that one of your dear friends had sexual intercourse with a woman you used to love in the very place you lay your head?

00:03:19:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:19:210000.Dialogue: That sounds like sarcasm, but I'm going to disregard it, because I have an agenda-- paintball. Specifically, the interdepartmental tournament this weekend. In order to function better as a fighting unit, I thought we should establish a chain of command. Now, it goes without saying that I would outrank the three of you, but the question remains, by how much? Now, I don't see me as some four-star general, back at HQ riding a desk and playing golf with the Secretary of Defense. But I also can't be Sergeant Cooper, because that might lead you to think of me as just a regular Joe. This might take some thought. As you were.

00:03:58:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:58:070000.Dialogue: What the hell is wrong with you?

00:04:00:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:00:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, how could you do that?

00:04:04:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:04:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, right. You're just jealous because it turns out I'm Penny's number two choice after Leonard.

00:04:07:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:07:150000.Dialogue: Hey, if I wasn't engaged to Bernadette, that totally could have been me.

00:04:14:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:14:000000.Dialogue: Please. Sheldon would have been before you, and he might not even have genitals!

00:04:19:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:19:040000.Dialogue: Why do you care so much? You're dating my sister, and Penny and I are in love.

00:04:24:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:24:220000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, if I may interject, I've decided my rank will be captain. If it's good enough for Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo, it's good enough for me.

00:04:35:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:35:120000.Dialogue: You're not in love with Penny.

00:04:37:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:37:180000.Dialogue: Yes, I am. The god Kamadeva has shot us with his flowery arrows of love.

00:04:44:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:44:040000.Dialogue: He's the Hindu version of Cupid, but way better, because he rides a giant parrot.

00:04:49:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:49:000000.Dialogue: Raj, come on. You fall in love with any girl who smiles at you. A month ago, you were writing poems about his fiancée.

00:05:02:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:02:120000.Dialogue: Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.

00:05:07:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:07:000000.Dialogue: That could have been about anyone.

00:05:11:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:11:070000.Dialogue: Besides, you have nothing to worry about, because now I'm the dusky half of Koothrapenny.

00:05:17:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:17:080000.Dialogue: For the record, I do have genitals.

00:05:34:180000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:34:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:39:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:39:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:39:060000.Dialogue: Oh. Coming. Yup, that's good. Wine glasses should have handles.

00:05:47:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:47:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:47:060000.Dialogue: Keeping accurate track of your alcohol intake. Smart idea considering how trampy you get when you've had a few.

00:05:54:060000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:54:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:56:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:56:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:56:000000.Dialogue: Well, I heard who you did.

00:05:59:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:59:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:59:000000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, I screwed up everything. I hurt Leonard. I hurt Raj. I mean, what is wrong with me? I feel like two totally different people-- Dr. Jekyll and Mrs. Whore.

00:06:13:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:13:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:13:070000.Dialogue: Don't be so hard on yourself. Do you know the story of Catherine the Great?

00:06:18:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:18:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:19:110000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:19:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:19:110000.Dialogue: She ruled Russia in the late 1700s, and one night, when she was feeling particularly randy, she used an intricate system of pulleys to have intimate relations with a horse.

00:06:29:020000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:29:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:29:020000.Dialogue: I'm... I'm sorry. What does this have to do with me?

00:06:33:090000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She can’t find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
00:06:33:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:33:090000.Dialogue: She engaged in interspecies hanky-panky, and people still call her "Great." I'm sure your reputation can survive you shagging a little Indian boy.

00:06:52:040000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:06:52:040000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:06:55:100000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:06:55:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:55:100000.Dialogue: What did you tell Howard?! Did you say there was something going on between us? Because he thinks there is! He's completely freaking out!

00:07:02:120000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:02:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:07:05:060000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:05:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:05:060000.Dialogue: Well... You were always so nice to me, I thought maybe you liked me.

00:07:10:180000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:10:180000.Speaker: Bernadette

00:07:14:120000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:14:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:07:16:100000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:16:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:16:100000.Dialogue: Damn right, you're sorry! And you tell Howard there's never been anything between us!

00:07:21:230000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:21:230000.Speaker: Raj

00:07:24:220000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:24:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:24:220000.Dialogue: Do you think I have a shot with Penny?

00:07:27:000000.Scene: Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
00:07:27:000000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:27:000000.Dialogue: Of course you do. You're a cutie pie! Any girl would be lucky to have you!

00:07:35:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:35:080000.Dialogue: You know, I've done this before. In kindergarten, I was supposed to marry Jason Sorensen at recess, but by the time my class got out there, he was already engaged to Chelsea Himmelfarb.

00:07:46:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:46:050000.Dialogue: So what did I do? Hung upside down from the monkey bars, let all the boys see my underpants.

00:07:52:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:52:110000.Dialogue: You can't blame yourself. When your prefrontal cortex fails to make you happy, promiscuity rewards you with the needed flood of dopamine. We neurobiologists refer to this as the "skank reflex."

00:08:03:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:03:130000.Dialogue: You know what? Let's get out of here.

00:08:07:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:07:200000.Dialogue: Somewhere where no one's seen me naked. We may have to drive awhile.

00:08:19:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:19:060000.Dialogue: Subtlety isn't her strong suit, is it?

00:08:22:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:22:160000.Dialogue: Can I stay at your place for a few nights?

00:08:25:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:25:000000.Dialogue: Really? A best friend sleepover? Yay.

00:08:32:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:32:180000.Dialogue: We'll make popcorn, stay up all night and I'll teach you my secret language, Op.

00:08:42:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:42:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm gonna go pack a bag.

00:08:55:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:55:180000.Dialogue: Do we really have to wear this camouflage crap to play paintball?

00:09:00:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:00:060000.Dialogue: Who said that? Leonard, I can hear your voice, but I can't see you.

00:09:05:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:05:170000.Dialogue: I'm not in the mood, Sheldon.

00:09:09:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:09:070000.Dialogue: Oh, there you are! Leonard, I know you're upset about recent events, and I have someone here to help.

00:09:17:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:17:230000.Dialogue: I don't want to talk to Amy.

00:09:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:26:140000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard, is it really necessary to caption the obvious?

00:09:30:180000.Speaker: Dr Hofstadter
00:09:30:180000.Dialogue: He's been like that since he was a toddler. Look, Mommy-- a butterfly. Maddening.

00:09:39:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:39:190000.Dialogue: What's going on? What do you want?

00:09:41:130000.Speaker: Dr Hofstadter
00:09:41:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon informed me that you're experiencing an emotional upheaval, and I'm here to help.

00:09:49:000000.Speaker: Dr Hofstadter
00:09:49:000000.Dialogue: And we're back to the obvious.

00:09:54:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:54:050000.Dialogue: Well, uh... okay. Um... I don't want to get back together with Penny. We tried it, it was crazy, it didn't work, but I can't deal with the fact that she slept with my friend Raj. And then I find out that Raj's sister Priya, who I've been going out with for eight months, is moving back to India. So I'm just completely confused and alone.

00:10:25:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:25:060000.Dialogue: Excuse me. You're a world-renowned expert in parenting and child development, and all you've got is "Buck up"?

00:10:37:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:37:130000.Dialogue: Thanks, Mother. I feel much better.

00:10:39:080000.Speaker: Dr Hofstadter
00:10:39:080000.Dialogue: If you need any more help from me, my books are available on Amazon. Logging off.

00:10:50:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:10:50:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:50:160000.Dialogue: ...ninety-nine, one hundred. It's like a waterfall of liquid gold.

00:10:59:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:10:59:130000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:05:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:05:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:05:210000.Dialogue: You know, I don't even know what the point of me staying in L.A. is. I haven't gotten a single acting job since I moved out here. The closest I came was last month, I got a callback for a hemorrhoid commercial.

00:11:16:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:16:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:16:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I could so see you being the face of hemorrhoids.

00:11:21:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:21:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:24:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:24:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:24:210000.Dialogue: Maybe I should just move back to Nebraska.

00:11:27:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:27:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:27:010000.Dialogue: No, I can't let you do that.

00:11:29:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:29:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:31:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:31:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:31:050000.Dialogue: For the first time ever, I have a thriving social life. And no pressure, but it kind of lives and dies with you.

00:11:40:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:40:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:40:050000.Dialogue: Hi, Amy. Can I talk to Penny?

00:11:42:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:42:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:42:100000.Dialogue: A guest in my trundle bed and a boy at my door? I wish I could tell 13-year-old me "it does get better."

00:11:49:090000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:49:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:49:090000.Dialogue: How did you know I was here?

00:11:51:070000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:51:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:51:070000.Dialogue: It's all over her Facebook page.

00:11:57:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:57:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:57:100000.Dialogue: I'll take your stuff to the bedroom and clear out a drawer.

00:11:58:230000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:11:58:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:00:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:00:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:00:140000.Dialogue: No problem. Try and keep it in your pants, okay?

00:12:06:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:06:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:09:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:09:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:09:120000.Dialogue: I was wondering if you're free Friday. They're having a Totally '80s Night at the Greek. Hall & Oates, Katrina and the Waves and three-fifths of Kajagoogoo.

00:12:17:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:17:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:17:160000.Dialogue: Oh. Gee, that's really sweet, but the thing is...

00:12:21:150000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:21:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:23:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:23:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:23:140000.Dialogue: Look, honey, I was really drunk and made a huge mistake last night. We should've never slept together. It's what ruins friendships.

00:12:30:220000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:30:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:30:220000.Dialogue: You can't ruin a friendship with sex. That's like trying to ruin ice cream with chocolate sprinkles.

00:12:38:170000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:38:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:38:170000.Dialogue: Come here. Just listen to me. I want to go back to the way we were before. You know, friends. No sprinkles.

00:12:50:080000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:50:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:12:54:030000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:54:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:58:150000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:12:58:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:58:150000.Dialogue: Well, uh...  as your friend, you might like to know that, um... we didn't have sex in the conventional sense.

00:13:17:150000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:17:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:17:150000.Dialogue: Oh, God. Did you pull some weird Indian crap on me?

00:13:23:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:23:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:23:020000.Dialogue: No, no. After we got undressed and jumped in bed, you-you asked if I had protection.

00:13:32:090000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:32:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:33:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:33:180000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:35:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:35:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:35:160000.Dialogue: Anyway, um, I had trouble putting it on and you tried to help and... that was all she wrote.

00:13:54:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:54:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:56:120000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:13:56:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:14:03:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:03:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:04:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:04:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:04:180000.Dialogue: Penny, please, please promise me you won't tell anybody about this.

00:14:07:160000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:07:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:07:160000.Dialogue: Of course I won't. No, I won't.

00:14:09:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:09:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:09:050000.Dialogue: Oh, good. Um, can I tell people that our love burned too bright and too quickly? Kind of a "Candle in the Wind" deal?

00:14:17:010000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:17:010000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:18:020000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:18:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:18:020000.Dialogue: Cool. Can I say it fell apart because you were all, "I want to have your babies"" and I was like, "I'm too rock and roll to be tied down"?

00:14:26:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:26:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:27:140000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:27:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:27:140000.Dialogue: Can I say I ruined you for white men?

00:14:33:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:33:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:36:050000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:36:050000.Speaker: Raj

00:14:37:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:37:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:39:130000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:39:130000.Speaker: Raj

00:14:43:100000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:43:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:44:150000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:44:150000.Speaker: Raj

00:14:46:220000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:46:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:46:220000.Dialogue: Okay. Raj, wait. Thank you for being my friend.

00:14:58:210000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:14:58:210000.Speaker: Raj

00:15:00:180000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:15:00:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:01:220000.Scene: Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
00:15:01:220000.Speaker: Raj

00:15:07:020000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:07:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:07:020000.Dialogue: All right, this is a Google Earth view of the field of battle.

00:15:11:110000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:11:110000.Speaker: Howard

00:15:12:170000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:12:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:12:170000.Dialogue: Give it a second to load. Whenever you're ready, AT&T! Okay, here we go. This is us here. To the south is Professor Loomis and the Geology Department. According to their Twitter feed, they're out of sunblock, which means they'll have to hug the tree line or risk melanoma.

00:15:31:090000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:31:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:31:090000.Dialogue: That's our edge. All we have to do is move quickly over this ridge, the rock-worshipping pasty-faced bastards won't know what hit them! All right, let's move out.

00:15:40:230000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:40:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:40:230000.Dialogue: Hang on, Sheldon. How could you not tell me your sister was moving back to India?

00:15:46:220000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:46:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:46:220000.Dialogue: Maybe he was too busy writing clumsy penis metaphors about my fiancée.

00:15:51:080000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:51:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:51:080000.Dialogue: Screw you. That was a beautifully written penis metaphor.

00:15:58:160000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:15:58:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:58:160000.Dialogue: You know what, guys, I'm not in the mood for paintball. What do you say we just bag it?

00:16:03:080000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:03:080000.Speaker: Raj

00:16:05:020000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:05:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:05:020000.Dialogue: You can't quit. That's a court- martial offense. That's punishable by... You can't quit.

00:16:12:150000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:12:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:12:150000.Dialogue: Sorry, Sheldon, it's just not a good time for playing games.

00:16:16:080000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:16:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:16:080000.Dialogue: This is a game to you? Uh, was the Battle of Antietam a game? Huh? Was the sack of Rome a game?

00:16:25:010000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:25:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:28:160000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:28:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:28:160000.Dialogue: Wait. I just want you all to know that I forgive you. This mutiny isn't your fault, it's mine. I haven't earned these bars.

00:16:48:090000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:48:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:48:090000.Dialogue: Although what I lack in leadership, apparently I more than make up for in sewing.

00:16:53:080000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:53:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:53:080000.Dialogue: Let it go, Sheldon. I'll get you a Jamba Juice on the way home.

00:16:57:170000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:16:57:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:57:170000.Dialogue: No. Jamba Juice is for heroes. And that's what we're going to be.

00:17:08:020000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:08:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:09:100000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:09:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:09:100000.Dialogue: Following in the footsteps of Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo.

00:17:27:060000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:27:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:47:220000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:47:220000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:51:090000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:51:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:59:220000.Scene: A shed on the paintball range.
00:17:59:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:59:220000.Dialogue: If there's ever a Church of Sheldon, this will be when it started.

00:18:09:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:09:090000.Dialogue: I'd like to propose a toast to the man whose noble sacrifice inspired our victory, Captain Sheldon Cooper.

00:18:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:17:230000.Dialogue: Excuse me. It's Major Sheldon Cooper.

00:18:21:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:21:120000.Dialogue: With my last breath, I awarded myself a battlefield promotion.

00:18:26:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:26:200000.Dialogue: It's kind of a big deal.

00:18:30:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:30:040000.Dialogue: Hi. You guys have a minute?

00:18:36:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:36:230000.Dialogue: Okay. Um...  Well, I already talked to Raj, but I wanted to apologize to the rest of you for, you know, everything.

00:18:46:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:46:220000.Dialogue: Please, Penny, let me.  We've decided to let our crazy, wonderful night together be just one of those memories you have and can call to mind when you're feeling blue or you're in the shower.

00:19:02:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:02:040000.Dialogue: Hey, what you doing, Quick Draw?

00:19:13:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:13:080000.Dialogue: Anyways, I wanted you guys all to know that I've been taking a really hard look at things and come to the conclusion I have to stop kidding myself. I suck at acting. It's time for me to move back to Nebraska.

00:19:28:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:28:230000.Dialogue: What are you going to do in Nebraska?

00:19:30:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:30:230000.Dialogue: I don't know, maybe teach acting.

00:19:38:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:38:060000.Dialogue: Penny, listen, I hope you're not doing this 'cause of you and me, because I have a girlfriend, and you're a single woman...

00:19:43:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:43:090000.Dialogue: Shh! It's my agent, it's my agent. You're kidding. Oh, my gosh. I can't believe it! Really?! Oh, I'm so excited! Thank you! Thank you so much. Okay, bye. I got the hemorrhoid commercial! I start Monday!

00:19:59:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:59:140000.Dialogue: Oh, hell with Nebraska. I'm gonna be a star!

00:20:10:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:10:220000.Dialogue: Have you ever thought of teaching physics?

00:20:23:180000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:23:180000.Speaker: Actress

00:20:25:130000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:25:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:27:070000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:27:070000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:29:000000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:29:000000.Speaker: Actress
00:20:29:000000.Dialogue: Oh, sweetie. Hemorrhoids acting up again?

00:20:32:140000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:32:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:32:140000.Dialogue: You don't know the half of it.

00:20:34:180000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:34:180000.Speaker: Actress
00:20:34:180000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, I do. Try a dab of this.

00:20:40:220000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:40:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:44:190000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:44:190000.Speaker: Actress

00:20:52:210000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:52:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:54:140000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:54:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:56:160000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:56:160000.Speaker: Actress

00:20:58:160000.Scene: The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
00:20:58:160000.Speaker: Penny
